Don’t @ me.By Emily SchultzOctober 7, 2019FacebookTwitterEmailIllustration by Łukasz GolędzinowskiFacebookTwitterEmailWhen my grandma calls to check in, it’s usually a Tuesday around 12:45 p.m., the time people in T.V. shows gather in a “staff lounge” to eat their Tupperware-packed lunches. She picks up on the fact that I’m at my desk, because I’m usually speaking softly, which is precisely when the concerned voice comes in: “Don’t you have a lunch break?!”Yes Nanny, I do have a lunch break. But I spend it at my desk, not because I’m a crazed New York Media person who spends all of her time checking emails and reading between the lines of the latest subtweet. But because I actually enjoy eating my lunch in front of my computer.I know, I know, everyone says that we spend too much time in front of screens, that we should be getting up from our chairs more, that we should be going outside, and what’s that thing about stopping to smell the roses? Well I keep my computer brightness down to a level that makes my eyes happy, and so what if I like the nothingness smell of a cookie-cutter corporate office? I’m still taking a break, just maybe not in the way the latest women’s health magazine tells me to.Here’s the thing: If you catch me chomping on my desk salad or leftover pasta or hard boiled eggs, I’m not actually working. I’m catching up on the latest from The Cut, or scrolling through meme Twitter, or reading the longform article my coworker Alex Beggs dropped into slack that morning. (She always has good intel on the things you should and shouldn’t be reading on the internet.) Looking busy enough that no one bothers me definitely feels like a win—and it’s way better than staring into some abyss for 30 minutes while poking and prodding some bibb lettuce.So the next time you see something about how peak self care, health, wellness, and happiness is taking 30 minutes during your day to be away from your computer, call bullshit, pull out your lunch, and read about Father Divine or WTF glitter is instead.Explore Bon AppétitLunchRecipes you want to make.
